Les Lampton, one of Mississippi’s most prominent entrepreneurs who created thousands of jobs and quietly shared his economic success with untold beneficiaries, passed away this morning. A life well lived. Thanks, Les, for all you did for our great State.
Mourning the loss of Barbara Bush, the matriarch of the Republican Party, this evening. We will miss her wit, wisdom, and leadership of this country.

quoted_status.full_text: We wake this morning with heavy hearts. Deborah and I mourn the passing of Jean Kirby, beloved wife of our dear friend, Sen. Dean Kirby. Sen. full_text: There are no words to describe how important Senator Cochran, a true gentleman and statesman, has been to Mississippi.  Lynn and I wish him and his family the best in his retirement and welcome him home.  Job well done. https://t.co/42Ic3OJBm6

quoted_status.full_text: @DelbertHosemann @CFNM_2002 We need more Delbert Hosemann’s in our state in office!!!!  Awesome man!

full_text:
@SelaWard @CFNM_2002 Thank you Sela, but you are still way to young to be in my political commercials.
Your acceptance speech was moving to each of us. All of us would hope this never happens to our children or any child. But it does to too many. You are making a difference to many lives in Ms.

@SelaWard was named Outstanding Mississippian by the @CFNM_2002 for her charity work at the Hope Village for Children in Meridian, which has provided hundreds of vulnerable children with a place to call home. A well-deserved honor for another Mississippian making a difference. https://t.co/fnI9JgGMgO

Today @RepTrentKelly earned the ranking of Brigadier General in the Mississippi National Guard. Please join me in thanking General/Congressman Kelly for his dedicated service to our State and our Nation.
